Flub.Name: Voronoi
Flub.Description: T

Flub.Name: Scale
Flub.Description: The perceptual scale of the Voronoi shapes. Higher values create more shapes.

Flub.Name: Jitter
Flub.Description: Control the offset of the Voronoi points between symmetrical and chaotic.

Flub.Name: Seed
Flub.Description: The randomization pattern or seed for the node's process.

Flub.Name: Dual
Flub.Description: Creates two overlapping Voronoi patterns.

Flub.Name: Warp
Flub.Description: T

Flub.Name: None
Flub.Description: No warping.

Flub.Name: Simple
Flub.Description: Simple, soft warping.

Flub.Name: Complex
Flub.Description: Complex, turbulence warping.

Flub.Name: Warp Frequency
Flub.Description: Frequency of the warp. Higher numbers create stronger warping.

Flub.Name: Warp Amplitude
Flub.Description: The strength of the warping applied to the base noise.

Flub.Name: Warp Octaves
Flub.Description: The complexity of the warping shape.

Flub.Name: Advanced settings
Flub.Description: T

Flub.Name: Scale X
Flub.Description: The non-uniform scale of the X axis.

Flub.Name: Scale Y
Flub.Description: The non-uniform scale of the Y axis.

Flub.Name: Euclidean
Flub.Description: Euclidean function.

Flub.Name: Manhattan
Flub.Description: Manhattan function.

Flub.Name: Natural
Flub.Description: Natural, geology-friendly version of Euclidean.

Flub.Name: C
Flub.Description: Voronoi cells with height decided by the cells themselves.

Flub.Name: N
Flub.Description: Voronoi cells with height decided by the nearest neighbor.

Flub.Name: P
Flub.Description: The default look for this geo-variant, suitable for creating mountains.

Flub.Name: A
Flub.Description: A mix between P and M.

Flub.Name: S
Flub.Description: Individual mountains with fully separated boundaries.

Flub.Name: M
Flub.Description: Favors the strongest cell; good for creating a big mountain slope.

Flub.Name: D
Flub.Description: Favors ridges over cell centers.
